===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なぎなた|薙ぎ|tr1=nagi|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|薙ぐ}} ''nagu'' “to mow, to cut down”|鉈|tr2=nata|t2=hatchet}}. The use of the {{ja-l|刀}} kanji is [[ateji]].

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|な|ぎな|た}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|o|な|ぎなた}}<ref name="NHK"/>
* {{ja-accent-common|h|な|ぎなた}}<ref name="NHK"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[na̠ŋina̠ta̠]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|長刀}}, {{ja-l|眉尖刀}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|なぎなた}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=なぎなた|weaponry}} a traditional Japanese [[halberd]]: a [[polearm]] historically used to cut down [[infantry]] and [[cavalry]]
